abstract.text: If your app crashes upon app start, it’s likely that your app can’t find the FreemiumKit SDK path. Learn how to fix your build settings.

metadata.title: My Mac app is crashing on start on TestFlight / during App Review – how to fix?

inlineContent.text: build setting in Xcode has both
in it. If one is missing, the SDK binary won’t be found.

FreemiumKit ships with an SDK binary that is automatically copied & handled by Xcode. While everything should work out of the box for most users, in some cases (depending on which version of Xcode created your project) your build settings might not be set up correctly. You might not notice an issue during DEBUG builds, but when you archive your project and upload it to TestFlight or to the App Store, the build settings need to be correct.
Select your app target in Xcode
In the top right ‘Filter’ search field, enter
If one of them is missing, add it by using the plus button in the bottom left corner of the modal

And that’s it, this should ensure that your app searches for the FreemiumKit SDK on the right paths and fix any app start issues. You can archive and upload a new build and everything should work on TestFlight / App Store.
Have questions or need support? Reach out to me at
Privacy: No personal data is tracked on this site.

abstract.text: The most frequently asked questions about FreemiumKit.

Can I use FreemiumKit for consumable products (like in-game currency / donations)?

abstract.text: Learn how FreemiumKit makes it easy to implement consumable in-app purchases for things like in-game currency, AI tokens, or donation/tip buttons.
Learn how FreemiumKit allows you to mark purchases as ‘legacy’ and how the SDK ensures existing customers can continue to use your app as expected.

abstract.text: Learn how FreemiumKit was designed to keep your users data private and reduce the exposure of your purchase data to a minimum.

doc://FreemiumKit/documentation/Freemium.title: How does FreemiumKit handle User Privacy?
Is Apple Watch Supported as a Platform in FreemiumKit?

abstract.text: Yes, Apple Watch is supported in FreemiumKit with a small extra setup step. Learn more about what that step is and what limitations there are.
